s.text: I do not deny that this was the perfect way to sell the movie, considering the scary witch story behind it; however, I think James Surowiecki is missing the whole point.
Twenty of 32 historians surveyed judged Nixon's presidency a 'failure'; none called it 'great.
They range from theological importance of the first magnitude to common practices that traditionally supported the theology being taught.
I suspect that someday historians who were not Nixon's contemporaries and didn't feel the emotions of that era will be able to give a more objective ranking--perhaps higher, perhaps lower.
